meanings.definition: To pay or provide for (costs, expenses, etc.)
meanings.sent1: She defrays the rent by working extra hours.
meanings.sent2: The company defrays the travel expenses for its employees.
meanings.sent3: The generous donation defrays the medical bills for the family.
meanings.sent4: His hard work defrays the financial burden on his parents.
meanings.sent5: The scholarship defrays the tuition costs for many students.

meanings.definition: To bear or offset (a part of the cost or expense)
meanings.sent1: The discount defrays some of the shopping costs.
meanings.sent2: His savings defray a portion of the car repair bill.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected bonus defrays the dinner expenses.
meanings.sent4: Her efficiency defrays the time lost in traffic.
meanings.sent5: The coupon defrays the cost of the movie tickets.
